member.name: T:SagaLib.Packet
member.summary: Defines the base class of a network packet. Packets are send back and forth between the client and server. Different types of packets are used for different purposes. The general packet structure is: PACKET_SIZE (2 bytes), PACKET_ID (2 bytes), PACKET_DATA (x bytes). The id bytes are considered to be part of the data bytes. The size bytes are unencrypted, but the id bytes and all data following are encrypted.

member.name: F:SagaLib.Packet.size
member.summary: The size of the packet is equal to the number of data bytes plus 2 bytes for the message id plus 2 bytes for the size.

member.name: F:SagaLib.Packet.data
member.summary: The data bytes (note: these include the id bytes and the size bytes)

member.name: F:SagaLib.Packet.offset
member.summary: Our current offset in the data array. After creation this will be set to 4 (the first non ID data byte)

member.name: F:SagaLib.Packet.doNotEncryptBuffer
member.summary: If true, the data byte array will be cloned before it gets encrypted. Set it to "true" if you want to send the packet multiple times.

member.name: M:SagaLib.Packet.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a new packet with the given length. The data bytes are initialized to all zeroes.

member.name: M:SagaLib.Packet.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new packet with no data bytes at all. The data array has to be initialized manually.

member.name: M:SagaLib.Packet.EnsureLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: 确保有足够的缓存区，不够则自动扩充

member.name: M:SagaLib.Packet.SizeIsOk(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Check to see if a given size is ok for a certain packet.
member.returns: true: size is ok. false: size is not ok.

member.name: M:SagaLib.Packet.New
member.summary: Create a new instance of this packet.

member.summary: Parse this packet (only used for GetPackets)

member.summary: Write the data length to the first 2 bytes of the packet.
